title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Merger activity slowed dramatically through July after a record year in 2021, hampered by lack of clarity about the direction of the economy and markets, and some deal makers are bracing for an even quieter rest of the year.

---

Amgen is in a pitched battle with the IRS over the company's international tax strategy and $10.7 billion in back taxes and penalties that the agency says it is owed.

---

Growth at U.S. manufacturing companies was its weakest in two years in July, but inflationary pressures showed signs of cooling as commodity prices eased.

---

Bearish investors aren't buying into hopes that July's rapid advance for stocks heralds the start of a new bull market.

---

U.S. stocks closed slightly lower, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow slipping 0.3%, 0.2% and 0.1%, respectively.

---

Estee Lauder is in talks to buy luxury fashion brand Tom Ford in what could be a $3 billion or more deal.

---

Toronto-Dominion Bank is close to a more than $1 billion deal to acquire investment bank Cowen.

---

A group led by Apollo Global Management is in advanced talks to buy airfreight company Atlas Air.

---

Evergrande said one of its units has been told to honor a $1.1 billion guarantee, revealing yet another large financial obligation that wasn't previously disclosed.
